verses.verse: Wisdom<WH2451> has built<WH1129> her house,<WH1004> She has hewn<WH2672> out her seven<WH7651> pillars;<WH5982>
She has prepared<WH2873> her food,<WH2874> she has mixed<WH4537> her wine;<WH3196> She has also<WH637> set<WH6186> her table;<WH7979>
She has sent<WH7971> out her maidens,<WH5291> she calls<WH7121> From the tops<WH1610> of the heights<WH4791> of the city: <WH7176>
"Whoever<WH4310> is naive,<WH6612> let him turn<WH5493> in here!<WH2008>" To him who<WH2638> lacks<WH2638> understanding<WH3820> she says,<WH559>
"Come,<WH1980> eat<WH9237> of my food,<WH3899> And drink<WH8354> of the wine<WH3196> I have mixed.<WH4537>
"Forsake<WH5800> [your] folly<WH6612> and live,<WH2421> And proceed<WH833> in the way<WH1870> of understanding.<WH998>"
He who corrects<WH3256> a scoffer<WH9238> gets<WH3947> dishonor<WH7036> for himself, And he who reproves<WH3198> a wicked<WH7563> man<WH7563> [gets] insults<WH9249> for himself.
Do not reprove<WH3198> a scoffer,<WH9238> lest<WH6435> he hate<WH8130> you, Reprove<WH3198> a wise<WH2450> man,<WH2450> and he will love<WH157> you.

Give<WH5414> [instruction] to a wise<WH2450> man,<WH2450> and he will be still<WH5750> wiser,<WH2449> Teach<WH3045> a righteous<WH6662> man,<WH6662> and he will increase<WH3254> [his] learning.<WH3948>
The fear<WH3374> of the Lord<WH3068> is the beginning<WH8462> of wisdom,<WH2451> And the knowledge<WH1847> of the Holy<WH6918> One<WH6918> is understanding.<WH998>
For by me your days<WH3117> will be multiplied,<WH7235> And years<WH8141> of life<WH9132> will be added<WH3254> to you.
If<WH518> you are wise,<WH2449> you are wise<WH2449> for yourself, And if you scoff,<WH9238> you alone<WH905> will bear<WH5375> it.
The woman<WH802> of folly<WH3687> is boisterous,<WH1993> [She is] naive,<WH6615> and knows<WH3045> nothing.<WH1077> <WH4100>
And she sits<WH3427> at the doorway<WH6607> of her house,<WH1004> On a seat<WH3678> by the high<WH4791> places<WH4791> of the city,<WH7176>
Calling<WH7121> to those who pass<WH5674> by, Who are making<WH3474> their paths<WH734> straight: <WH3474>
"Whoever<WH4310> is naive,<WH6612> let him turn<WH5493> in here,<WH2008>" And to him who<WH2638> lacks<WH2638> understanding<WH3820> she says,<WH559>
"Stolen<WH1589> water<WH4325> is sweet;<WH4985> And bread<WH3899> [eaten] in secret<WH5643> is pleasant.<WH5276>"
But he does not know<WH3045> that the dead<WH7496> are there,<WH8033> [That] her guests<WH7121> are in the depths<WH6011> of Sheol.<WH7585>
